result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Submit DNA and pay surcharge
*Make all current child support payments
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment as recommended by the Agent
**If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

timeConds.notes:
Report on or before January 19, 2018; clean and sober
Huber Granted
May transfer to Sauk County

Defendant Robert A Rivera in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant makes a statement to the court.

Atty Hendee objects to electronic monitoring being ordered.
Atty Frank makes arguments for the electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 22, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Robert A Rivera in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will enter a plea today but will ask for a sentencing date.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Counts 2 - 11 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee waives the request for a PSI.  Atty Frank agrees and is not requesting a PSI.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Counts 2 - 11 to be dismissed and read-in.
No PSI will be ordered.
Set for Sentencing
bond continued
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2017 at 09:15 am.

  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.

*Appear for booking today
